author: Tomule
title: Treda: A transactional carbon tax
description: Offset Ada's transactional energy use with an plugin that diverts a % of that transaction towards a fund that is used to reforest farmland.

assessments.note: By aiming at Cardano's environment impact mitigation, this project could bring value to Cardano and increase adoption by people who care about global warming and are reluctant to blockchain technology and its image of high energy consumption : it does address the challenge. As a side effect, I assume such environment friendly Dapp will help to enlight the true the environment impact of blockchains and thus promoting Cardano over others as it is 99.99999% more energy efficient than Ethereum.

The idea is great, we shall focus on the carbon emission suppression and giving something back. Unfortunately the proposal would welcome more details about its detailed project plan, team content as well metrics. I would suggest to improve the proposal and work through.
This may be an interesting idea, however there is little detail in the proposal.

Is Cardano's energy use high? I don't think it is. It might be better to market your project as simply an environmental charity. What's Treelabs? More info about the feasibility and security of a wallet plug is needed. How will the project reforest farmland and ensure the forest will be permanent? It sounds like it would be very expensive.

There is no clarity in the purpose of this proposal and how it addresses the challenge, there is no mention of dapp. I recommend clarification. In addition, there are no goals or metrics that make it possible to measure the impact of the proposal on the challenge.(A smart contract was mentioned, but it is not clear what the need for that smart contract is if the proposal is only to include a plugin in the wallets)

The energy requirements of the Cardano network, and thus its carbon footprint are a tiny, tiny fraction of those of Bitcoin and Ethereum. So instead of presenting it as a problem we need to solve, we should try and advertise it as much as possible. If the idea presented in this solution would be implemented, it would most likely create mixed messaging and even have a negative impact on the adoption of Cardano, possibly driving users away instead of encouraging adoption. Instead of focusing on ways to mitigate an almost non-existent problem we should think of ways to educate people on why and how Cardano is millions of times more environmentally sustainable than BTC and ETH.

A smart-contract and a Daedalus/Yoroi plugin seem a clear and easy solution to me. An assessment of the risk of not being integrated into these wallets with a good visibility would help the community to assess the chance of success. Also the governance of the Treda fund lacks of details : I think for example to the use a dedicated Treda token/share granted in exchange of the carbon tax that could enable to involve the community in the decision process of the Treda Fund and bring engagement.  Raters can also consider that the proposer does not have programming skills, and no details are provided about  the development team.
Some experience is given for part of the job, but many other aspects aren't covered. Budget spreading and time plan would be also welcome.
The proposal has little detail and the proposer has not demonstrated domain or technical experience.
What previously successful projects of yours can you highlight?

There is no clarity in the purpose of the proposal, there is no clear and structured plan. The lack of clarity in the objective makes it difficult to understand the aptitude of the proposer to develop the proposal, but there is no mention of skill with software development or smart contracts, so there is no indication of relevant experience.

There is no details on resources allocation.

It is not clear whether this additional transaction tax (carbon tax) will be mandatory or optional, if optional it would be just a donation and of low complexity, but if it is mandatory it is something that needs to go through a vote and a governance process. One cannot simply decide to create a tax on the network by the arbitrary will of anyone.

In addition, what is the environmental impact of Cardano's pools on the environment? This question needs to be answered before the feasibility and relevance of the proposal is understood.


The energy expenditure to operate pools is extremely lower than the costs with bockchains that use PoW, this is inherent to the consensus protocols derived from PoS in general. The energy expenditure of PoS blockchains is practically negligible in the grand scheme of things.

Where would these taxes be used?

The proposer describes himself as a graphic designer, yet this project would require a lot of technical knowledge in order to be implemented. However no plans are described on how this is to be achieved. If resubmitted I would suggest including a detailed plan and a broken down budget, so the community can better asses the feasibility of the proposal.

Project milestones are lightly described, but not scheduled. The use of funding is not detailed. We can assume that the release of the Treda Smart Contract and one the wallets plugin is a definition of success, but we are missing intermediate milestones. Additional description of intermediate development steps  would help assessing the progress of the project.
Due to missing metrics, milestones it is hard to judge the audibility.

More detail needs to be provided in how the proposal would technically work. THe proposer should find collaborators who can then implement this. How will reforestation projects be chosen and audited? Even Norway's sovereign wealth fund with its vast resources has trouble with monitoring donations to address issues like this.
How will success be measured? Have you thought of running a charitable stake pool?

There is no information to audit the proposal.

There is no clarity on the problem and how the problem addresses the challenge, I recommend that the proposer provide details on energy expenditures of the  Cardano blockchain to support his proposal.

No clear roadmap is provided, and no planed deployment date is mentioned, I would strongly recommend including these in any future iteration. The team behind the project is not clearly described and in the case that there are plans to hire additional personal, it would have been helpful to include those in the proposal.  I would have liked to see a more clearer explanation of the phrase once the project is completed any unused catalyst funding would go to the 'Treda' fund. How exactly would that fund function, and what value would it bring to the Cardano community.

solution: Through accountability and early adoption this could help mitigate Cardano's energy impact, and help us steer towards a renewable society.
experience: I have a background in graphic design, am passionate about the potential of cardano in society and am eager to build on it.
